title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 1000.2 - Description
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 1000.2 - Description

State Regulations

Certain inmates, because of the nature of their crime, status
or behavior, require special evaluation and tracking of their movement through
the correctional system. The (CMC) process is a comprehensive internal
management system that provides a discretionary means for the department to
identify certain inmates for special evaluation and tracking purposes based
upon a standardized set of criteria and identification
procedures. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7
ยง
1000.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
